title: Did my research, get it
review: I have lived in China for 3 years and have a two-year old boy. Once he was born I became more interested in what all the AQI apps actually did and started researching them. AirVisual is by far the best one I have come across (having used 10+ different apps). Not only can you choose to use the US index (which I would highly recommend) you also can see which pollutants are contaminating the atmosphere at any given time. I also have a laser egg (also highly recommended) which is a portable particulate counter and the readings on my mobile device and the closest monitoring station on the app are always within +/-20 meaning they are not contradicting each other. On other apps there would often times be a 50 point+ difference between what my particulate counter read and the other random apps I was using. Also, do note that some apps do, like airvisual, have the different pollutants listed and their levels but airvisual is the only app I have found that combines that with the ability to choose the US AQI standard. My go-to app when it comes to air pollution.

title: Your AQI in an app
review:
This free app can help you with information and forecasting of the air quality in your area. Since the 1970’s I’ve been personally interested in my home environment mainly because 3 of my family members, my husband & 2 children have hay fever in the Spring. We installed an electronic air filter in our furnace and air conditioning system which seemed to help immensely. 

Fat forward another 30+ years when we discovered the AirVisual app & their small device that could monitor our indoor air quality. Yes, using an AirVisual device is an easy way to monitor and improve your own air quality in your home. I discovered that NOT opening the windows to bring in a little fresh air was bad for us. Our carbon dioxide CO2 levels were getting in a higher range and causing headaches and lethargic behaviors. Being retired and at home most of the time, this became even more important to monitor our indoor AQI. Thank you AirVisual for providing the tools and information for a healthier lifestyle. 🥰

title: Potential Lifesaver
review:
It is only just beginning to seep into the public domain how catastrophically harmful poor quality air can be. It can irritate you, hurt your head and your heart, kill you or cause dementia. Checking air quality before engaging in outdoor work is vital especially in summer months. This is a simple but well-designed app that will display pollution levels and warnings for whichever monitoring stations you select. It can also provide notifications of changes in air quality. I have not yet come across intrusive tracking, data collection or advertising; it's not necessary to create an account to use it. I check it before working outside just as I check the (standard) weather forecast. Perhaps if we use products like these we'll come to see how we are, without exaggeration, poisoning ourselves.
Highly recommended.

title: Forecast data is completely unreliable
review: While current local condition air quality seemed accurate, the forecast data, even just a few hours ahead, was completely wrong. I live in Oregon and we had horrible air quality last summer, in the unhealthy range repeatedly, even crossing into hazardous at times. With many wildfires burning across our region, we are all jumpy in fear of a repeat. For some reason, despite consistently good air this year, the  app predicts unhealthy air 4 hours in the future every single day. During the first week I cancelled a number of recreational and outdoor activity plans based on these predictions. I am especially peeved about one of these cancellations, something that I really wanted to do and lost some reservation money. I followed the site for another week—same thing every day. I know air patterns and fire conditions can change rapidly but AirVisual was never correct. The forecast ability was the main draw for me so I deleted AirVisual and swapped it out for an app with a very simple design, just current AQ numbers in bubbles on a map, easy to navigate around a region.

title: Peace of Mind
review: The app is so helpful as a quick reference to the air quality outside. I don’t have to guess and I know the reading is legitimate and accurate. In London, pollution is a major concern and exacerbates respiratory issues especially for children. I use AirVisual as a guide to determine when I turn on the air purifier for my infant son. The monitoring station is close to where I live so I am getting information that is up-to-date and relevant to the particular area where I live. My next step is to purchase one of the AirVisual monitors so I may see the readings in my own home as well as contribute data to the community. The app is very informative, giving you the basic or in depth information whichever  you may prefer. Keep up the good work!

title: Can be useful, but not always accurate
review:
I use this app to help prepare for bad air conditions, since I live in the PNW and the wildfire smoke aggravates my asthma. The statistical information and maps are really interesting and informative and the app itself is easy to use, but now I'm concerned that the information I'm getting is not accurate.

There is currently an air advisory due to smoke in my area. For some reason, this app is insisting that the AQI is "Good" despite the fact that I can actually see pollution in the air. I'm not sure if this is really the app's fault or the fault of wherever the information is being sourced from, but regardless, I don't think I can rely on the information I'm being given to help me make informed decisions about my health anymore. It's unfortunate since I was really excited to find an app like this in the first place. If you decide to download it anyway, please be cautious and don't use it as your only source of information.

title: Great resource!
review:
Discovered this app a couple of months ago and find it very useful in evaluating air quality, ventilating my house, and considering how to improve air filtration in my house. With continuing fires and air pollution in N California, I have developed bronchial irritation and increased congestion (which closely tracks air quality conditions reported by air visual). I attribute the good info to lots of reporting stations in my area.
Of particular interest is knowing when to ventilate my house (during periods of good air reported by air visual). Also, the app is helping me evaluate the performance of my whole house air filter system; my house filter helps but need improvement.
As a result of the app's functionality, I'm considering buying a larger version of IQAir's home air purifier as an adjunct to my whole house filtering.
I give a 4 star rating because there is always room for improvement.

title: Horribly inaccurate.
review: I live in South Korea and have for a total of 5 years, spread out over the last decade in a 3 year stay and now 2 years into a 5 year stay, in that time the air quality here has gotten much much worse. I was recently diagnosed with asthma (something that is apparently becoming more common for people in Seoul) and have to check the air quality regularly. If it's above 100 aqi I have to wear a special filter mask to leave the house. I got this app to make it easier to check the AQI regularly, one of the big draws for this app is it notifies me if the AQI goes above 100, or it's supposed to. Yesterday it never dropped below 100 and I never got a notification (thankfully I'd had the thought to check online before leaving the house) and upon checking the app it said an AQI of 63 when it was really 163. If you're relying on this app for all your AQI information and live in a city with poor air quality such as Seoul you may be putting your health at risk by relying on this app.

title: uncomfortable UI and sightly more cautious air rating
review:
This app is useful because it has daily notifications and a widget. I use this app to check the air quality in Korea. But the number that this app reports is almost always higher than the Naver number, which is probably most correct in Korea. If it’s :( unhealthy on AirVisual, it’s just :/ not good on Naver. or if it’s :/ not good on AirVisual, it’s :| ok on Naver. It can be good to be cautious though! 

The worst part about this app is the UI. Swiping from the left never works to go back to the previous screen so I have to move my hand and push the back button in the top left corner. So annoying! There are a lot of menus on the bottom that I never click on like a map, a world ranking, and other not-that-useful stuff. Overall, it’s not that nice to look at and a bit frustrating to navigate. So I give 3 stars.
dev_response:
Thank you so much for giving us a detailed and constructive feedback!
1- AirVisual reports the US AQI standard which indeed differs from the Korean AQI standard. The Korean AQI standard is less strict and therefore indicates "better" value than the American standard.
2- For swiping from the left, it will be in the next version!
3- The menus on the bottom are there to bring context to the data: the map shows what's going on around, the ranking gives an idea of how a city fits compared to other key cities, the articles are there to bring an in-depth view and understanding about the pollution problem.

title: Terrible app with device
review: If you have an air iq, which I just bought. This app is pretty terrible. It has HUGE gaps in the reporting. For example I have my device on all day. And the graph for “daily” report only shows info for 10am-2pm then a huge gap of no data, and then more reporting from 5pm-11pm, then a huge gap again between 11pm-2am. It’s completely random each day with times it will decide not to record info. The decide itself shows what happened over the last 24 hours fine. But the app shows these huge gaps which makes it useless since you can’t look back at history on the device itself beyond a day. So this problem with the app makes in unusable and also severely damaged the usability of the device too since you can’t access historical data beyond a day. This makes testing in a bad air home almost impossible to see if you are making any progress or not. For a $300 device, the app should work flawlessly with it.

title: Easy & quick air quality check
review: Very easy to use and a great resource to check the current air quality in your area. Nice option to buy an AQI device that can registered and used in their system. They are a bit pricey though. Recommend the app!

title: Incredibly helpful for people who live in China
review: Well, download this app now if you’re living in Shanghai or Beijing. The air quality of Shanghai is extremely bad in winter as pollutes were blown over from the north in this period of time. With the app you will be cognizant of when to wear a mask when going out.

title: Painfully inaccurate
review: Here I am sitting in air so smoky they cancelled school and sent the kids home. The sun isn’t visible and I can barely see my neighbors across the street. HOWEVER!!! Your app shows a green happy guy and says the air quality is great!!  Meanwhile all other apps are telling me don’t go outside and keep windows closed. Three sensors in this town and you cannot get it right? We have been in smoke for a month and a half. Carr fire here in Redding ca. Now the Delta Fire. We haven’t seen numbers like you are claiming in a VERY long time. Moving on.

title: Good app but weird issues
review: I like this app a lot. It really helps with my asthma and being able to predict when I'll need my rescue inhaler, especially during wildfires in California. I've had issues in the past with updating the "my places" section, but it seems good now!

title: A great resource esp during CA wildfire season!
review: I check this app regularly when there is a fire event happening within a 300 mile radius and it helps me to know when to carry my n95 air masks. I also check it obsessively to see when air has cleared up and it’s safe to go outside and take a big whiff.

title: Alaska Wildfires
review: This app is working great for us. We have been breathing in smoke all summer from the wildfires. The app has helped us plan our activities around the worst parts of the day. It tells us when the air quality is best during the day. It’s a very helpful and informative app. Well done!

title: Actionable notifications
review: Much more accurate than the other 3 devices I’ve tried and the app does things like tell me its a good time to open my windows!  I’ve had allergies for 15 years and it’s like I have a new friend watching my back when I want some fresh air:)

title: Love the app!
review: It’s extremely helpful during the wire fire of California.  I was checking it every hour before deciding on going outdoor or opening the windows.  It’s nice to be able to view the AQI and PM2.5 as well as seeing the daily trend.  I wish there were more cities since my city is not included.

title: Very satisfied
review:
Downloaded the app because of the current fires in the part of California where I live, so far seems to be helpful. It includes up to 7 days forecast.
Apple Watch App needs some serious work, unresponsive but the data is very valuable and it works like a charm on the iPhone

title: Good
review: I find this to be very accurate, and helps us manage decisions as it relates to living w/asthma. I wish it would send alerts, like a text or banner on my phone. I have set it up to send notifications, however this feature isn’t working. I signed up for an account to see if this would fix it, but it didn’t.

title: Best air quality app so far
review:
I live in Northern CA where we call Autumn “fire season” and not because the leaves look like fire. This year was better where I live than past years but you can’t always tell right away when the air is bad or if it has become more dangerous. This app warns you (if you let it) when the air quality has changed, good or bad,  and uses a lot of different data from many sensors around the area including privately owned and EPA etc. that give a much better reading in the micro climate air. It’s very easy to use as well. 
I highly recommend getting this app to keep track of the air quality where ever you go.

title: Nice features, OK accuracy, one of many
review: I’ve found a number of sources to test my air quality. AirNow doesn’t have as many local sensors, so it’s best for a general idea and for ozone levels, which some don’t display. My favorite for local particle readings now is PurpleAir, which has local sensors and you can add your own, similar to Weather Underground, and you can even integrate with their site. AirNow has the unique feature of displaying overall air quality from your device home page as if it’s the number of notifications you’ve missed. Took me a minute. Now I have my general idea of air quality at a glance. Good for those of us opening and closing windows, turning on and off air filters, or wearing masks to exercise outdoors. Thanks for a stable app. Build those sensor numbers.

title: Good but Needs UI Improvement
review: Although I live in a major metro area next to a large International airport, the nearest monitor is a good 10 miles way.  I essentially have to guesstimate based on the distant monitors that surround me.  The UI is perplexing; it apparently selects the closest monitor with a name that doesn't mean anything even though there's another monitor thats slightly closer.    Clicking on the monitor name doesn't show the map (or option for it); you have to bring up the separate map section and figure out where your monitor is and add other nearby monitors to your favorites.   Once figured out, it's quite useful for it's purpose but the UI needs to be simplified and hopefully a monitor from the airport will be added although I'm guessing that's out of the developers control.

title: Great international coverage
review: I spend a couple of months every year in northeast rural Thailand visiting my wonderful Thai in-laws. AirVisual's coverage of Thailand is excellent and helps guide me in taking antihistamines and using an inhaler when the sugar cane farmers are burning their crops. They do this prior to harvesting the sugar cane before they sell their sugar cane to the processing plants. Although the Thai government is actively encouraging the farmers to adopt different methods to improve air quality, the burn method quickly and efficiently prepares the sugar cane for harvesting. Consequently, change is slow. Beyond Thailand, I appreciate AirVisual's accurate air quality measurements and the ability to make a list of cities to monitor air quality.
dev_response: Thank you for your detailed review. We're glad that we help people with the air pollution data. Wish you safe and clean air!

title: Helpful Beyond Expectation
review: I started using AirVisual during the November 2018 California fires. Now that the smoke has (mostly) cleared, I will keep using it. AirVisual not only tells you what the Air Quality Index (AQI) in your area is but also provides detailed information on what an AQI is and how it’s measured. The app provides both local and global (via a 3D globe) views of how our air is doing. It provides a ranked list of major cities based on air quality (thankfully San Francisco is now down to 68 ... during the intense smoke from the fires it was up near the top 10 of worst places to breathe), news articles on air quality and resources.  And there is more! Highly recommended.

title: App is a literally a life saver!
review:
More info is much better than less info to make an informed decision to expose yourself to harmful pollutants. Certain ill informed so called Educators working against the free flow of info do us all a disservice.  I very much doubt air visual would try to manipulate data to sell products.  You don’t need a degree to step
Outside and see the acrid air.  Is too bad Vietnam has let special interest override people’s health. This app and the info is critical. I am moving because the govt is not doing anything to stop pollution and the Vietnamese people are literally choking to death. Thanks Mr  Vu Khac Ngoc for being small minded and limiting available info.

title: Asthma Family Says Thanks!
review: This app has been incredibly helpful for our family. We have 3 people in our family with asthma, one of which has severe asthma. This app helps us to know when they are safe to play outside and when going to the museum or the mall would be a better idea. We live in the Rocky Mountains, so, the smoke can get pretty intense here during the summer, which makes us use the app multiple times a day. The only problem for us is that we live in the mountains so the air quality is different here (usually worse) than it is where the air quality monitor is. The closest monitor is 30-45 minutes from where we live. Other than that, we love this app!

title: Oh say can u see!
review: Well, even if the air is not as clear as we would like, I live a short distance from the Carr fire in northern CA, this app really helps to let us know the current air quality as well as the weather. When I first starting using the app I was unaware of all the GREAT features that were at my fingertips. Wow, it is like having my own weather station right in our home. From current weather for this days activities to predicting what we can expect later in the week. It is a wonderful tool that helps us make plans for all our outdoor activities. Thank u developers for a wonderful app. The Ryals family😁

title: Best Headache control
review: Having this app allow me to know what’s going on with the air outside makes me super aware and careful of what’s also going on inside. It helps me know when to use my air purifiers and went to stay Away from the outside we had a major California fire blow through it in my hometown and the smoke put us in toxic levels and I don’t know what I would do without this app to keep me safe. It absolutely has gotten my headaches back under control I was so miserable every day in so much pain I recommend it for anyone that suffers or knows anyone in their family that suffers from any type of breathing issue

title: Fantastic easily navigated app
review: This app is so easy to configure and navigate through and provides so much valuable information. We are extremely polluted right now in the San Francisco Bay area because of the wildfires. With the single glance on the map display we can see how our relatives are doing in Grass Valley California and how things are in San Francisco and Palo Alto and anywhere else for that matter by simply zooming and scrolling.. With the favorite places page I can see details on cities I have selected with seven day forecast if I want. Right now severe pollution in San Francisco is still basically just the equivalent of a not too bad day in New Delhi!

title: Very helpful
review: I just started using this app this past summer. I have severe asthma and have found this app very helpful . Especially when we had smoke in the Willamette Valley from forest fires. I now check the air quality daily. It has saved me the risk of asthma attacks by letting me know when it is best to stay indoors.

title: Saved my lungs in China!
review: This app is a godsend. It works fine behind the Great Firewall too. If my VSP is off I still know. Also when you see the app icon it lists the air quality value in red so you don’t have to open it. I’m asthmatic visiting Beijing. With the app and my n-99 mask I’m doing well! Thank you for this magnificent app!

title: Very practical for daily
review: My parents lives in Beijing, and it is not everyday hazardous level of air quality. However, it is not healthy for your body most of the time, this app helps my parents to know the air quality so they can decide whether they want to wear a face mask. Thumbs up!

title: Great app
review: This is a very handy app to get an idea of how the air quality is. Great to have while there was one major fire in the local area, and another massive fire where the smoke blown to our county and many others as I work outside it was nice to know when I had to wear my N90 mask. Very useful app. Thank you .

title: Breathe Easier
review: Just understanding the air quality in advance helps me know what to expect, and I can prepare accordingly.  I check it every day and it is displayed on my screen on the app as well.  If you have a sensitive respiratory system then I would recommend this app.  It is better for me to know in advance than be surprised by an anxiety attack!

title: Accurate Readings... Love it.
review: I love it that this app shows data for individual neighborhoods and not just the entire city...Readings are pretty accurate. Pollution numbers on this app match with data from Airnow and other sources. I was surprised to see huge difference pollution just few miles away.

title: Very helpful
review: Wish this app could be more accurate by using zip codes, as SF has many micro-climates. Currently, I check this app for air quality every morning to determine if I should open my windows for fresh air. If it’s not in the green zone, I leave it closed and depend on my Health Pro Plus to purify the indoor air.

title: Great app!
review: I couldn’t of got through this year without this app. I was so glad to find it. I have a cute asthma and I was having a really hard time. The smoke has been unbelievably hard this year for me. So kudos to the maker of this app I couldn’t of done it without you thank you so much.

title: Excellent, but depressing
review: This is a great app. It lets you see at a glance what’s your local reporting station says. It agrees with the website, but you don’t have to open up the website all the time it’s just stays right on your screen and you can tap on it to get the detailed report.

title: Handy ap
review: I have lung problems and I travel around the state for work so it’s very handy for me to check the air quality where I’m going. This app is simple and convenient. I do wish that I could delete locations that I don’t use or when I’m done with them.

title: Useful and provides insight
review: This app is very helpful whether you are traveling into the big city or just staying home.  I never knew about this until it was recommended to me by a youtuber.  If you plan on traveling, whether it be across country or just in to town, this app provides the right information you need to know about the air quality.  My only qualm is since I live on the coast, the nearest AQI reading is 66 miles away, so it’s not really accurate for my local area but great for when I travel into the metro area to visit family.  Maybe one day there will be an AQI for my area.

title: Useful
review:
This app has been great to have during all the wildfires happening around the West this summer. It updates quickly, and shows data from many locations.
Cons: forecasting air quality is not really possible in the same way as weather - even though this app was predicting that every day the AQI would keep rising to “Very Unhealthy”, it did not turn out that way in our location due to ever changing winds.
Also, the AirVisual Earth display is very cool and a pretty advanced feature in a free app, but I wish it would show state boundaries or some other geographic features to help me understand exactly where my community is, within the outline of the U.S.

title: Love the info-as far as it goes. Definitely recommend as one tool.
review: Great app, but as a small population state in MAINE. I am in the second largest city, Lewiston and I am not sure if the readings ARE actually for LEWISTON or the most well known city of PORTLAND which would mean a difference for someone like me. What would be very helpful for people with lung diseases and air quality issues- knowing mold/ mildew spore counts as well as allergens such a ragweed, goldenrod, and other pollens. These are just as important to know for most of us. Thanks for the app- I have been telling others about it, but then I have to go to other sources for the other info- one app that would tell me everything I need to know as a person with severe lung disease and allergies would be the BEST!!!

title: Valuable For keeping daily track of air quality
review: First time I used this  , I knew it would help with my overall daily routine of getting outdoors and run my errands . I check on the air quality daily and it lets me know when I should limit my outdoor activities, I’m under a Doctors care for COPD , and this has been a very helpful tool in managing my breathing maintenance. I gave it a five star rate , because it enables me to see at a glance the air quality immediately, instead of waiting for the weather news on tv or radio . I recommend this app to everyone .

title: Sorry to need it but glad it’s there!
review:
This app is a handy and convenient way to check your air when that becomes necessary.  I can see it’s smokey outside on my own, but having the rating lends weight, objectivity, and a sense of whether we are headed for a clearing or bogged in for a long haul.  
The only points for improvement: it isn’t  in sync with AQI-US, which is typically lower in its rankings leaving one to wonder which data to trust.  Also, given how much AQ can vary in even short distances, it would be nice if it were easier to check the air in areas not included in the list of cities and not very close to the cities that are listed.

title: Great app for planning my day
review:
I recently moved to Long Beach and discovered my lungs do not like this area! For weeks I’ve been cycling to and from Long Beach to Seal Beach, walking my dog a couple times a day and just really enjoying the outdoors. My asthma, which hasn’t been triggered in years, hit me like a ton of bricks and landed me in the ICU for breathing treatments. Now I have a nebulizer and a respiratory mask!

AirVisual has provided some great resources for me to plan out my days to minimize lung inflammation. Needless to say, this app has also encouraged me to move out of this area! I knew LA was bad, but I was blown away to see what horrible air quality levels Air Visual captures...its a major eye opener.

title: Good current info, horribly inaccurate forecasts
review:
The app will tell you when the air is bad currently, but its forecasting seems completely disconnected from reality. It will pretty much always tell you that the air will get cleaner later in the day or tomorrow, even when other forecasters, and common sense of my experience tell you it won’t. 

I live in Salt Lake City , and during the winter we get poor air when there is no wind or weather system passing through. The local forecast can accurately predict when these systems will occur and clean the air. However, AirVisual seems to always say the air will get better tomorrow, even when no weather is coming for a few days.

title: Simply fantastic
review: It’s a great app that allows users to consume data in a easy to understand and useful form. As a suggestion, it would be nice to be able to track aqi over the years various months and years, as well as see averages for various times. Winter in Dhaka is always far more polluted than summer and having this option would better assist researchers and journalists trying to highlight the problem. While the data exists, AirVisual has a way of making it easy to consume. Overall a great app that everyone I know in Dhaka checks daily.

title: Good stuff!
review: Extremely helpful to keep tabs on hazardous air quality due to wildfires. I check this app a zillion times a day during the fire season.  Love the map feature which is easy to manipulate & loads pretty quickly. Would like to see a more precise forecast feature on the main page, although the current forecast info seems pretty good. Also would love to see expanded readings for coastal areas which don’t have any info due to lack of data stations, I guess. I am inland, in a metro area so there’s a ton of available info, but no info for the entire coast of Oregon   Highly recommended though.

title: I really want to have this app...
review:
I want to be able to monitor the air quality for the sake of my child (who has a chronic condition) to aid in deciding if we do outdoor or indoor activities. I really was hoping this app would work, but there are FAR too many times it will say it’s a green air quality day with little or no particulate concerns when in reality it’s an orange or red air day. 

For example today there is literally ash falling from the sky as a result of a near by wildfire....and the app says it’s a Green Day with only 11 US AQI. If I look it up on a trusted web site it says it’s a red air day with 191 AQI. Since I can physically see particles in the air and even indoors can only smell smoke, I’m sure you can understand which one is the accurate one.

I’ve officially given up on this app as I obviously can’t trust it.

title: Good information
review: Helps plan when to go outside. Just wish it updated more frequently,  sometimes it is several hours behind.   And, my local station has not been updated for two days.

title: Informative and Helpful Info
review:
During the last week of July and four weeks in August this app helped immensely in planning out my schedule for when I could be outside as I suffer from respiratory issues from being an ex-smoker! 
I highly recommend it’s use for anyone.

title: AirVisual is Awesome!!!
review: AirVisual has been a life saver in the last few years since we’ve had these multiple destructive wildfires in California - thank you for allowing us the opportunity to share with our loved ones about the air quality in our respective areas.

title: Essential
review: I’ve never rated an app before, but this review is worth the time. Sadly with increasing fires and poor air quality referring to this app has been super helpful for me. I’m thankful this information is available. I find the interface to be mostly intuitive and I appreciate how visual it is.

title: Just what I was looking for!
review: With all the forest fire smoke settling in Seattle and literally shifting as the wind blows, was really hard to know when it was wise or even safe to open the windows and doors.  Most of us in Seattle do not have air conditioners and it gets pretty hot and stuffy to stay buttoned up.  Thanks for the app.  Doing a great job.

title: I like this app!
review: This app provides accurate information which I deeply appreciate. Other USA apps often just paint a rosy inaccurate picture. I also look at air quality in other cities here and all over the world. Important to me. Asthma runs in my family. Breath is life. Thank you.

title: Amazing
review: This app was an eye opener! Found out my home had bad ventilation all thanks to this app and was able to fix it the next day. My air quality went from poor to good because it helped me figure out the problem. Highly recommend.

title: App works even if inaccurate
review:
I like how this app will send me notifications and shows a particulate count without needing to open the app.
It says it is getting info from EPA but the numbers never match. Right now Air Now says particulate is 127 an Orange Action level. The app says air quality is good at 39.

Air Now is a trusted air quality site by the EPA.  Get rid of your bogus sources that are giving you filtered air quality numbers.   Even by your bizarre scale the count should be above 50.

title: Love the updates Helps me plan my day
review: With fire season upon us that pollution varies from merrily and healthy two very unhealthy and the app allows me to choose the times that it’s best to do errands and even just to go outside and change the water. And let me know when I absolutely must wear my mask

title: Very Useful
review: I live in HCMC Vietnam and the air quality here has been deteriorating rapidly for the last years. This App lets me see when it is really terrible  (over 200)and when I need to wear a pollution mask. I run so this is quite important I don't get stuck out running with out a mask.

title: Big help for those with asthma
review: This app has a wonderful interface which makes it incredibly easy to understand the quality of air around you.  It plainly gives you the index right along with the forecast (which seems really accurate) and suggestions like to open or shut the windows, to minimize exposure outdoors, etc.  this app is very clean and presents practical information.  I enjoy it so much that I just purchased their personal indoor air quality monitor to help me better understand and control my indoor environment.

title: Helpful during California wildfire
review: The app was very helpful during the devastating wildfires in California. We were able to know the level of air quality in the Bay Area which was heavily affected by the fires and knew when it wasn’t safe to be outside. The extra information given about the specific types of air particles was educational and easy to understand. I like the visual depiction of our air quality levels at a glance and to be able to know when during the day it would be safer to go outside and what the weekly outlook is.

title: Thanks! It’s a MUST HAVE app!
review:
I just moved to Salt Lake City and had no idea the air quality (especially in the winter) was so poor. I wondered why when I’d go for a run I’d cough, sneeze and get a terrible headache. Now I know and can monitor/limit my outside activities when the air quality is going to affect me.
This app gives me notifications (YAY!😃) when they air quality changes, is super easy to read and also lets me see days in advance so I can better plan. 
It’s a must get for those living in poor air quality areas or those susceptible to reactions.

title: One of my favorite apps!
review:
Air Visual is a well thought out and essential app for helping you plan your day if you live in areas with good and not so good air quality. I’m in Northern California and bc of ALL the fires Air Visual has been extremely helpful in being up to date with our deteriorating air quality. It also has some fun or interesting features that allow you to get an idea of air quality around the world
So right now our air quality is as bad as places in the world where they regularly wear masks.
Thank you AirVisual for making this app!

title: Just moved to South Korea three days ago
review: And this app is literally saving my life. I had no idea the fine dust was such a big deal until I was sleeping with the window open and woke up short of breath. I downloaded this app and the air quality was purple, 230! I closed the window and now this is at the top of my widget list and checked constantly......really regretting moving here only because I didn't realize the fine dust was so bad here too...anyway for the next year, until the contract is up, this app will be my lifeline. Literally.

title: Just what I needed!
review: For those of us with asthma or COPD checking the air quality index is as necessary and frequent as checking the weather. AirVisual is much easier than looking up data on the web. Its predictions for four times during a day help plan activities. The app uses data from the nearest monitor near me so helps me be aware of differences within the city as I move about.  The listings for cities around the world remind me that my struggle to breathe is only my glimpse of what millions are enduring with a problem we must address.

title: Helpful
review: I recently moved to Cincinnati, where the air quality is often poor.  (This purple state has laws to mandate emission checks for cars more than 3 years old but doesn’t provide funding for car emission centers, so laws are unenforceable.). This app helps me time and pace my outdoor activities - shifting activity to Times with better air quality has helped my older toy dog, who developed bronchial problems after moving here. I use the app several times per day and compare it to other air quality forecasts - it seems pretty accurate.

title: Very Impressed
review: I just found and installed this app in August, due to wildfire smoke. I am very sensitive to the smoke and monitored my outdoor activity by it. I do not have any other gauge to compare this app to, but even when this app showed down to  yellow, and other people thought the air was clear in comparison to when the air was red, purple or maroon...I could still feel the smoke in the air. With that, this app seems spot on to me! I also like being able to see the global air quality as well. It always worked when I went to it!

title: Easy to read AQI
review: I have been trying out a few apps and this one seems to be the easiest when you want to know just the AQI. Seeing exactly where the readings are coming from and the last time they were updated is so necessary. I like that it gives specifics on what pollutant concentrations are. I can’t tell if these readings are accurate though since every other source of AQI shows different readings. But with the other sources I don’t know when the last time they were updated and the exact location of the readings. So I assume this is most accurate.

title: Weird inaccuracies
review: So overall it’s helpful, but there are occasional weird inaccuracies. I’m in western Washington state where we have been inundated with forest fire smoke and much of the region has high pollution values. There is a random city near me (Issaquah, WA) that has consistently show very good values, even while surrounded by smoky areas. I contacted the company about it and they had some hard to decipher response but basically said that the Issaquah sensor is not measuring all pollutants. It wasn’t clear then as to how other sensors measure pollutants and how accurate any readings are. I would expect consistency, but it’s not happening. So take the readings provided for general guestimates only I guess...

title: Helpful and Interesting
review: Very impressed with this app.  The local information is very useful and the worldwide information is interesting and motivational.  But before I buy a noisy air filter, I’ll be buying more air-cleaning trees and plants (like the Areca Palm, Dracaena & Chinese evergreens, etc.) for both indoors and outside.  The world needs trees.

title: Reliable
review: We check the air quality daily. It helps us have the policy conversations we need to have with our friends, neighbors, and local government. We can see the effect of pollution in our air quality and AQI helps us quantify what we’re experiencing.

title: Helpful
review: I live in a country with high levels of PM2.5 pollution and I check this before leaving the house to see if I should wear a mask. I also love the visual map. I have my own air monitor at home that is cheaper than the one advertised on AirVisual, so I don’t use the other features.

title: Extremely useful and Easy
review: This app is simple to read when there is poor air quality. I used this living in SLC during the inversion days to know if it's safe to send my kids outside. I also use it in Oregon during wildfire season when the smoke gets super thick. Love this app

title: Most Accurate Local AQI
review: Love the local AQI maps.  Very helpful to know when to stay inside, run air purifiers and if need be, wear our masks. I have a three year old and it’s helped to see the ranking of our city next to other polluted areas in the world.  We may need to move!!!

title: Very helpful
review: We’re in the Bay Area and are using this app to help plan when we have windows open and when to close them based on the info on the smoke from all the fires. It also helps because our kids ride their bikes to school.

title: I Don’t trust this app very much because...
review: According to this app Havana has very great air quality when it isn’t. How can this be? I have lived most of my life in Havana and the city’s air is very polluted. Old diesel cars from the 50’s won’t let you breath and your buggers comes black from your nose. Is like living in India but in the Caribbean when it comes to air quality. I remember most mornings were dimmed by the smog from the cars exhaust and me covering my airways. Don’t trust any information coming from Cuba as it can be fake!

title: Extremely useful
review: I take my dogs on two 30-40 minute walks daily and I was surprised to discover that the air quality can be poor even if the skies are clear and blue.  This app helps me decide if we are better off taking a shorter walk.

title: Greatest app reason ;
review:
Riverside has over 250,000 cars trucks etc etc
Driving through its cities every day so to survive 
This app support life by giving you real time day to
Day to information about air quality so you can decide on going outside are not  in my case 69 years old male  this app gives the information to
Go out or not it’s that’s important on bad days like 
In summertime 100 plus degree weather it’s like
Trying to breath under water it’s impossible to function many senior citizens have died because they couldn’t survive outside

title: Information is Useful and Easy to Understand
review: Highly recommended to view the air quality in the region. Information given is easy to understand and could be used a reference in order to make a decision.

title: Asthma! Very helpful in Northern California
review: I have asthma and I wish I had this app last year during our Santa Rosa fire. It’s tragic to say I find it useful today as the near-by Butte Cty “Camp Fire” rages on.  The data is reliable and it’s a great asthma management tool.  Having the AQI rating appear on the app on the home page of my iPhone is a great. But even better is that it’s also an Apple Watch app so I can view it on my watch.  Wish it were an Apple Watch complication. I would load it on the watch face. Maybe a future enhancement?  Love the maps.

title: Love the app since we are perpetually in fire season
review: I uploaded the app 2 years ago when we started to get really bad air quality due to fires. We used to open our windows at night and close it up in the morning, but if it is smoky that isn’t good. We now have a heat pump but prefer to open the windows if the air quality is good. So this app is great for knowing the current air quality but the forecast for the next several hours. Then we can decide to open the windows or turn on the heat pump.

title: All the info you need
review:
As a recent expat I wanted to try to make things as healthy as possible for my family. Air quality can be effectively controlled in your home but only if you know what you're dealing with. AirVisual lets you see what the outside air is and gives forecasts that I've found to be mostly accurate. When paired with an AirVisual node you can monitor your inside air quality as well and tailor your filtration plan accordingly. 

My only gripe is that you only get reports on outside air at 2 hour intervals while some other apps offer up to the minute results.

title: Start your day with fresh air (at least to know what’s coming)
review:
I don’t go check the air quality every hour. But simply by getting the morning push-alert on the today’s air quality help you to prepare and plan for the day. 

For instance, if the air quality is bad in the afternoon but good in the evening, then I know I should limit outdoor activities afternoon and go for a run in the evening. Those small things really helps me feel better on my nose, especially if you have a sensitive one.

title: Good for people that have breathing problems
review: I am a mother of 4 kids and 2 of my kids have severe asthma and so do I. As a mother I try my best to not let my kids get sick and that they have their medicine in the house in the car and in school even in my sister and my dads house have my kids medicine because it’s hard to tell when will they have a breathing problem and now a days the weather and the pollution it’s good to have this app to know how safe and how to plan the day even better

title: Great App and Hope More Countries Participate
review: When we landed in Seoul and noticed how dirty the air was, our friends suggested it was due to bad air blowing in from China, and that we get this app. Very pleased with it, especially after we went to Shanghai. We were able to hone in on exactly how bad and unhealthy the air was, and wha we could expect in other cities we were going to. As I have trips to the Stans — e.g. Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan— coming up I looked for them, but sadly there was no air quality station in those countries.

title: Very cool
review: Never followed this before but now I’m understanding what’s effecting my at times debilitating congestion is not allergies. Really accurate for my neighborhood so far (brooklyn, New York). You can even have the air quality number stay on top of the app the same way notifications usually appear. But seems like you have to open the app for it to be updated/refresh to the latest air quality number. I guess that’s the only thing that’s not the best so far.

title: This app is great!
review: The information about air quality is available but it used to take a lot of work to find and interpret,  AirVisual takes that away and makes it a one click event. I often plan my day around the information.  An example-While recently traveling to Bogota I learned the air pollution was spiking over night, each night while I was there.  I moved my exercise from early morning to early evening and avoided massive exposure.  I am healthier because of it.

title: Was great, getting worse...
review:
This app use to be great and seemed to give accurate readings from around Hong Kong. Recently however some reading stations have been removed and the areas it does give readings for seem drastically wrong/way too low/healthy. Today for example when in you can hardly see for the thick smog in the air, my two closest monitors are saying it’s 88. There is simply no way that is correct. 
Sadly I’m now going to have to find another more accurate app which I don’t want to do, but I want truthful readings of the air quality before taking my kids out to play.

title: Glad we found this
review:
We were dealing with smoke from wildfires on a recent trip.  To make sure we didn’t go out for a walk when the air was unhealthy for someone with lung issues (which my hubby has), I hunted for a good way to be sure.  And this worked perfectly.

I’m now using it regularly at home, too.  Also to check places for future travel.

It’s so easy to use.  Works beautifully.  Nice that it links to official air quality monitors, too!

title: Great app!
review: Can track air quality of multiple cities easy and they get their information from multiple sources. Also shows helpful tips on what to do when air qualify is bad - like closings windows and when it’s best not to exercise outside.

title: Website has an app!
review: I have been using the website associated with this app for over a year and was not aware that they have an app. This is very interesting information especially for us Californians wanting to know if we can go outside!

title: Perfect
review: This app is perfect for my needs. I have asthma, and it seems like Northern California is on fire at least once a year now. This app helps me decide whether or not to go outside, if I need to close my windows, if it’s time to wear the mask etc. It’s simple, easy to use, and it isn’t glitchy.

title: Appreciate but uncertain
review:
I appreciate the local data provided to the app for my location.
However, News reports state that air-quality to be very poor due to smoke from fires; then when I check the app, it states that air-quality very good. So I wonder about this discrepancy.

title: User friendly and Accurate
review: I really like this app. The information provided is extensive and it is really easy to adjust what cities you want information on. It seems to have pinpoint accuracy. Very useful tool for gauging air quality.

title: Awesome
review: Love that it tells me what is in the air We are breathing. I did call for assistance on setting up the device but got no call back. I did figure out how to get the WiFi working on my own. It would have been nice to get that call back. That’s why I gave the company 4 stars. Too bad. Because I would have given it 5 stars.

title: Helps with Job Search
review: I am an English teacher, who is ready to travel the world. I don’t mind visiting cities with terrible air quality, but living there is a different story. I am very happy about this app, because it is helping guide my job search. Thank you!

title: South Korea conditions.
review: I am a Safety Professional and I use this app daily to post the air quality in South Korea where myself and my one hundred coworkers are. It gives us an opportunity to wear masks when we know the numbers are elevated. A must have information source for all Safety Professionals world wide.

title: Pretty great—
review: —especially right now while we need it in CA! Works as advertised, there are many interesting features. The only thing I’d add would be some means to put the info on your phone’s screensaver/lock screen. Thanks for the app! It’s been crucial this last week in SF Bay

title: EU std
review:
This is the most accurate and reliable system so far. More people should participate in order to establish even better and precise system. 
Thanks!

P.s. This is for Apple, you should enable like(or similar mechanism) button for reviews. To show how much people adore or not some review!

title: Very useful, straightforward app
review: Really useful app, especially when air quality is so quick to shift based on wind and weather conditions.  Good to know if you want to take a day or hiking trip with the smoke from mega fires, sleep with the windows open, go for a run.  Especially for people who have sensitive lungs who need to avoid high pm counts.  I wish more locations had the tools to measure air quality so they would be listed, but lots of cities are still on here.  Would reccomend.

title: Real value in a free app
review: I have used and told others about this app for years. I have a rare autoimmune disease with a myriad of debilitating symptoms.  But the most frightening is bouts of difficulty breathing. Before I open my door, or step outside, I look at this handy app to know if the big city air is likely to cause me problems. Trial and error has shown me that this app can make the difference. I love this app. I just bought the IQAir.  Thanks for helping me breathe easier, literally.

title: Great app
review: Use it every day multiple of times. Have respiratory problems and need to decide if I need to use ask or not. I live  12 miles from the center of the Camp fire in California. Your scores for our town (Chico) are out of the scale above 400. So it is imperative for all in Chico to keep track of these scores. The air out there is actually harzaduos.  Your software is an easy an quick way to get the need information to make decisions about our moving about.

title: Amazing App
review: I used a different app when I lived in China for a year and this far outshines any of the ones I used there. This app has helped me so much during the Butte County Camp Fire. AQI is accurate and I enjoy that the AQI is color coded and shows the break down of each color. Right now I’m just waiting for yellow or green before I can take my dogs out for long walks again. Highly recommend app, especially for Californians since we don’t have a fire season anymore.

title: Very helpful air quality app!
review: I’ve been using this app multiple times a day over the past month to track air quality due to wildfire smoke in my area. It has been invaluable to us in several respects. Knowing when it is important to use our N100 masks outdoors has been helpful. Being able to track multiple cities and towns at the same time let’s us know where we can go to find cleaner air nearby is great!

title: Convenient
review: I love that the badge on the app icon shows the current rating. I can see at a glance without even opening the app what the quality is in the air outside. We’ve been having a lot of wildfire smoke lately and the app helps me figure out whether I need to be wearing a mask or not. I wish that there were reporting stations for more cities. Currently I use one for a town nearby that’s smaller than Santa Rosa. I’ll raise my rating to a 5 when that happens and when it actually works on my Apple Watch.

title: Nope, not run today ...
review: I have lived in Shanghai for over 20 years and before this app, we only knew the air quality couldn’t be good. The local reports back then were always “optimistic”. Now with this app, I have instant and accurate data on the air around me and anywhere else in the world. It’s been a real eye opener and breath of fresh air ... well maybe the opposite on many days here. I recommend this one, the best I have used so far.

title: SF, the new Beijing
review: I started using Air Visual when my daughter moved to Beijing so I could imagine her daily life there. Normally, the air is so clean in SF that I wouldn’t consider looking up the AQI here. But now, amidst the rampant wildfires, the AQI in SF for the past several days has been “extremely unhealthy.” Thankfully Air Visual showed me at a glance just how bad it is, so I’ve been limiting my outdoor activities and wearing a mask. I hope this is not our new normal. But it shows just how valuable Air Visual can be

title: Essential App
review: This is an essential app for people living in or traveling to places that have challenging air quality. I live in Hanoi Vietnam. After using this app I bought two home units. One for outside and one for inside so that I could get a local comparison. As expected, I now have data that supports keeping doors and windows closed. The inside air quality drops significantly when the patio door is left open for just 10 minutes.

title: Nice but could be faster
review: This is an incredibly useful especially for those who live in a not-so-clean area. But the App could be faster especially in the map view mode that some of the data points could be averaged out to reduce the display data which would not only make it easier to glance but also would make the App runs a little more efficiently in the map view mode.

title: Super easy to use. Amazing amount of info!
review: I have asthma and I use the app to help me know when I should stay inside, which happens all to often in Salt Lake City due to our inversion problem. I can’t believe that I can see a map of the pollution anywhere in the world.

title: Very helpful!
review: Love this app. It gives a pretty comprehensive overview of the air quality in almost any city. Only reason I docked 1 star was because some cities I searched for were not available. Also, I wish it had a similar setup to the Apple weather app, where you can save cities that you commonly visit.

title: Very helpful
review: I know which days to keep my curtains open but windows closed due to the recommendation by the app. I also know if I should plan to wear a mask or not due to my asthma. Great app especially because it is world wide too so when I’m traveling I have an idea what to expect.

title: 😷
review: This app doesn't help you breathe better. That's not a bad thing. It's not a nebulizer or a machine that has a mask that attaches to your face. It's simply an App that provides you with ADD feet of the air quality around you and neighboring cities or places or in the world outside and show to death because you don't know it's in The air.  Comes in handy

title: Very helpful app
review: This app is easy to use and you can see the air quality anywhere in the world. It shows current and forecasted levels. You can have it display the numerical AQI (Air Quality Index) for your local area directly on the app icon so you can see the air quality without even opening the app.

title: Can’t breathe without it!
review: This is the best app if you’re an outdoor enthusiast! It’s my go to app for timely information about air quality. The auto notifications, set up for your area, give you quick information before you go out on a run or bike ride.

title: Great App
review: This has proven to be the most reliable source for accurate and current air quality that I’ve used. With all the current wildfires and Unhealthy air, this information is vital for advising family.  I’m really impressed with the map and major cities.

title: Seems to do what it should
review: Over all it seems to do what it should. Some times it seems a bit out of date. I will check other sources and the other one seems more up to date But for the most part this is a great app. It is easy to use and presents the information well.

title: Keeping my toddler healthy
review: I’ve loved being able to check the moment-to-moment air quality in Bend, Oregon (and anywhere else we travel to) to ensure my toddler is breathing easy. We know to avoid long outdoor playtime when the numbers get too high. This app is awesome!

title: To mask, or not...this app answer the question.
review: I live in an area that frequently has unhealthy air.  Checking this app before I go outside let’s me know if I should wear a mask or not.  I love feeling able to walk outside knowing I’m taking precautions for my health when necessary.

title: AirVisual is a breath of fresh air app.
review:
Pardon the attempt at pun. 
I recently moved to Bangkok and knew all about the poor air quality by following AirVisual before my relocation. Now I really don’t need to follow this app for the air quality index rating in LOS, Land of Smog as all I need to do is look out from my high rise in the morning. I still monitor the air quality on AirVisual just to see if my air quality rating number is close to the index. I’m getting pretty good at guessing.

title: As someone with moderate to severe asthma this is literally a lifesaver
review: I know if I need to wear my N94 cloth reusable masks before I leave the house. Not that I leave the house without them but still. It also based it on your current exact location rather than just say San Francisco area so you know exactly what it is in your area not an average of a whole city. This makes a huge difference. Awesome app. If it weren’t free it’d be worth the money to buy it.

title: Good for real time AQI
review: This app is seemingly more accurate than other sources for my location. I like the interface a lot. The predictive quality is good for about 12-24 hours out but beyond that it is a lot more of guesswork.  I wouldn’t base all my plans on the 7-day forecast however I don’t dismiss it either.  They have helped a lot with the fires in CA to know when to lock down the house and bring air masks to go shopping.

title: Good app for monitoring pollution (esp. in China)
review:
I have tried various apps for monitoring air pollution. Some apps can provide a more detailed pollution prediction but this app can do everything to quite a good standard.

This app has been particularly useful for me when living in China. Where some apps can get blocked or take ageees to load. This app has worked seamlessly in China and has always seemed to give ratings that are reliable. Overall, 5 stars.

title: Super helpful.
review:
With the wildfires in California and constantly changing air quality, this app has been great to have. Even though it sometimes may not smell like smoke, there’s still toxic particulates in the air. However, this app helps me determine whether it’s safe to go running outside. 

It would be great if it had more specific locations like the california bay area coast towns like pacifica, half moon bay, Santa Cruz, etc where people would like to escape to.

title: Love this App
review: We are experiencing high-volume of smoke and small particles in the air here in California this year. This is tragic what is happening to our beautiful state and the people who live here. This app has helped me understand air quality which I now realize is more important than weather. It’s easy to use and has up to date information about places all over the world.  Thank you for creating this App!  It’s the best.  Michelle

title: Extraordinary app
review:
People do not realize how important it is to keep humidity levels, polluted air and temperature at healthy levels, IQ air has been very precise measuring all of these and it also keeps a record I have all these measurements for days, months and hours.
I’ve had no issues with this equipment and the display is very nice, sleek and user-friendly, I am going to buy another one and I definitely recommend this.

title: Great for traveling to China!
review: I’m an exchange student in Beijing and I use this app every morning when I wake up to gauge whether or not I need to bring a mask. So helpful and super accurate. I also like that it tells the temperature and humidity so that I don’t have to use other apps. Super great and easy. Also, has an online store that allows you to buy approved air filters for your home with a great price range. Won’t stop using!

title: Comprehensive, Accurate, and Well Organized
review: This App has the right information, where you can find it, and in a way that helps you make decisions for your day. There is both a sophistication in the data it provides for each station and easily digestible graphs and tables of that data. Its location search function is straight forward and user friendly.

title: Air Visor gives me readings but
review: Not bad to use unless you have breathing issues. They say a reading of 50 is acceptable but that’s too high for me. I have issues starting at 30   It would be great to know if this reading is a result of smoke or exhaust fumes etc. I need to use equipment with filters when it is higher or I am coughing and wheezing on these days. It would also be great if they could predict the next approximate numbers. If smoke is in the air from wild fires such as Canada and California I could really prepare myself ahead of time

title: Great App
review:
My country is currently facing some pollution problems due to forest fire.
Having this app to monitor the situation is a big help.
Not to mention Im raising an infant. It helps to know when the air gets somewhat better to open our windows or take my baby out for a walk.

title: Very helpful
review: I can see easily on my phone what the air quality is for my location. It is automatically updated when it changes. I get an optional notification of the changes. Extremely helpful

title: A Necessity
review: You’ll need this app on your phone if you’re planning on living in or traveling in China.  As of the time of this review, it doesn’t require a VPN to run and it’s accurate to US standards.  Other apps that I’ve used for AQI in China have fallen victim to governmental hacking, tampering, blocking or general lack of updates by the developers themselves.  Anyway, this app is good.

title: Very Useful and Great App
review: Visually simple and user friendly. Very useful App. given the increasing number of wild fires occurring during the dry season. Would like to see more information displayed on various PM without having to drill down on a particular node. At the very least, it should display the worst of PMs.

title: Small minor function
review: Sometimes the quick display won’t open on the quick doc on my iPhone. Otherwise it usually is very accurate and clear

title: So accurate and a MUST HAVE!!!!!
review: I found this app from my Dr during the CA fires a year ago. I have mild asthma and was able to see the days I shouldn't even attempt going out. Right now I'm in Sydney and the air quality is "unhealthy." All my Aussie friends now have installed the app.

title: Useful app
review:
I don’t care about the accuracy of this app. But it remind me wear the mák to protect my healthy when going out.
Please re-publish this app for Vietnam. Only Vietnam gov and their stupid force want to bring it down by give bad review & rating. There are so many people still need this app, thanks!
#ĐMCS & bò đỏ

title: I Inhaled!
review:
Yes, it’s true! I inhale all the time.

I started using this app during the devastating wildfires that raged through California to gage when it was safe to go outside. Not just for me, but for my kids and animals. There were times when the smoke was thick as fog!

But, you know there are times when it’s clear and you think it’s ok and it’s really not. This app lets you know.

Save a bunch of locations just like a weather app. Use it both in the city and out in the country. You’d be surprised how much crap (particulate matter) that we breathe each day!

title: Excellent Air Quality App
review: This is an excellent app to use when the air quality in your community is consistently elevated. I used this almost hourly during the 2018 Camp Fire in California. Helped prepare me for the various air quality levels before I left home or work.

title: It’s exactly what you need
review: When half of the state is on fire. I never used to really care about air quality... I DO NOW. Actually I started running last year so now I’m REALLY interested in air quality. Great job guys! I check out this app multiple times a day.

title: Informative!
review: The app keeps me aware of daily conditions during travel so O can adjust my activities. I’m now considering to carry a light mask with me when heading to parts of Asia. It also is great for home so I know how to manage the air purifiers and open windows more effectively.   I hope even more chemicals present in our air will be monitored over time. Looking for an extensive monitoring tool for home near landfill too! Thanks.

title: Allergies to pollution
review: This app is extremely helpful and accurate. Since I have severe allergies to pollution and need an air purifier, this app alerts me about the air quality outside so that I know if I need to wear my mask. I’ve used this app as part of a teaching tool for my lesson on air pollution for elementary students to show up to date air quality in current location and other locations throughout the day and week.

title: Essential app for those in the West
review: This app is brilliant. It’s visually very pleasing in a way that makes it easy to gather lots of info for your day and week ahead so you can plan life around the smoke. It’s got a lot of information, too—packing in weather forecast and wind shifts as well. It beats the AirNow DEQ website hands-down (and by a huge margin). Lastly, it’s super easy to navigate. So sorry an app like this had to me made, but grateful that it was!

title: Peace of mind
review: I check this in the morning and afternoon or before I’m heading outside.  It seems very accurate as well.  Once I forgot to check and went outside to the park.  I could see that it was very smoggy and sure enough when I checked the app it advised that I should stay indoors.  I am also glad that this service has got ppl thinking more about their air quality and how to help it.

title: Valuable tool
review: I live in California’s Central Valley, which fills with polluted air from the Bay Area, even on a good day.  Massive forest fire smoke recently filled the valley and forced me indoors.  Even that move was limited protection anywhere in the gigantic Central Valley.  So the app really helped this 72 year old guy with decisions about when to venture outdoors.  But I only found the immediate data to be useful.  Predictions of future pollution are loaded with variables (like fire and local wind) so I find the 7 day feature to me mostly hype.

title: Awesome resource!!!
review: The information that this app makes available to me enables me to know when and where I will encounter low air quality and high counts of airborne particulates. This information helps me to plan outdoor exercise and also in home air filtration cycles. It also helps me to know about air quality in areas where I will be traveling and how to plan accordingly. This app is an awesome resource, thank you!!!

title: Good, solid app
review: The app I was using prior to this became unstable. Found this and it has been solid. Only complaint is that is does not list all of the monitoring stations in the state of Utah, USA. I haven't tried to verify all of them however I am unable to add the station in Logan. I know it exists however this app does not list it. This is unfortunate as air quality is a serious concern in that town during winter months. 4/5 for not having all the stations.

title: Perfect
review: I am living in South Korea and could not understand the weather apps recommended by locals. This is the first one I’ve been able to use. This app is in English and very easy to navigate. I love that it sends me notifications in the mornings, because it’s very easy to forget to check if the air is healthy. My health is a bit better now that I know when to where my mask outside.

title: OZONE
review: It is a fairly good app, it could update information faster and a little more often. When you get to go out side and it depends on the accuracy this could do much more for us if it up dated the information faster, if I look at the app and it say that it is 15 and green and I take my wife outside and she immediately starts choking and is unable to get a breath, I look at the app again and it is still showing green than it finally updates and it really is 49 red. That is why I don’t give the app a higher rating. Fix it than I will repatriate it.

title: Multiple Chemical Sensitivities
review: I am coping with MCS and became acutely aware of the importance of outdoor air quality when the Camp Fire began in Northern California. Sometimes the air looks so bad that’s it’s obvious I need a mask to go outside. But on days when it’s less obvious I can look at my phone to find out whether I need to use my mask. Also I can look ahead to see which days I need to plan for low air quality.

title: Love the forecast feature!
review: This app is amazing. Super helpful, updates often, easy to to use and accurate info. Right now with the wildfires in CA it helps us see the change easily and in real time. Much better than the app I was using.

title: Great app!
review: This has been so helpful in our daily life and keeping us healthy. It is accurate and better than others because it uses your approximate location instead of the whole city generally.

title: Super helpful
review: Downloaded this during the Seattle summer smoke out when smoke from every direction settled over western Washington. It was so helpful to negotiate over the days we were inundated and I have continued to check it even though we’re mostly out of the woods.

title: Easy to use
review: Makes tracking air quality easier than the AirNow website. Good interface. Ability to save multiple locations is nice for those of us who travel in areas prone to getting forest fire smoke. Worth it!

title: Trustworthy all over the world
review: In many countries around the world, it’s difficult to get accurate air quality information. Where I live for example, they use an entirely different scale that downplays the severity of p.m. 2.5. This app always shows me what I need to know.

title: Best air quality indicator
review: I started using this app when I was in Asia because I was worried about the air. It has helped me avoid running on notably bad days in the States as well.  Also, they improve the interface every so often.

title: Great app
review: Great app but couldn’t give 5 stars because it needs more sensors around the world (the nearest one to me is 20 min drive).  It also could be more user friendly. Otherwise I don’t know if there is anything like it and it saved me while traveling overseas because I suffer headaches when pollution is bad so it helped me prepare.

title: Medellin Colombia
review: I’ve tried several air quality apps over the past couple months and this one has the most available sites and is the easiest to use. Both my spouse and I are using it now.

title: State of mind
review: This app has been crucial past two summers in determining if we can be outside. Wildfires bring so much smoke but sometimes when you get used to it you assume the air quality is okay and this tool helps you decide what’s right.

title: Great app
review: I knew the air quality must be bad since I’d had a severe reaction: sore throat to laryngitis to coughing to wheezing. Getting the app and actively monitoring the air quality— first, confirmed my suspicions that I didn’t have a cold. Next, allowed me to make decisions for my health based on the readings in my area. I’m sold.

title: Very helpful and needed!
review:
It enables me to get critical info I need.  I think that the detailed info could be clearer though.  I can’t tell what those little details mean.  Also, when you select “7 day forecast”. It only gives you 4 days.

I can’t seem to save this review because it keeps saying my nicknames are taken?  Really?  The 3 I’ve chosen are odd and random.  I think this is a glitch.

title: A must have app!
review: I rely on this app daily to see how the air quality is. I have asthma and it is very important for me to know whether the current air quality allows me to go mask free or wear one. You never know when and where bad air is. I was recently in Bangkok, Thailand, and this app warmed me of bad air there. If it weren’t for this app, I would have been oblivious and spent too much time outdoors. Thank you for the great app!

title: Great app - no guessing your location
review: Living in Beijing means contending with days when you either mask up or stay inside if you want a reasonable life expectancy. My favorite part of this app - one of them - is that it gives you the AQI of the monitoring station nearest your location. The news bits and forecast are nice touches but always knowing the air quality where I'm at makes this my go to app.

title: Great app for what it does
review:
I live in a valley.  We have 4 major forest fires within a 100 miles of each other. It has socked the valley with smoke.  With this app I can see how bad it is outside all around us  and very local    So I know if I need to wear my mask 
The only draw back is it doesn’t update some time for hours but I don’t know if it’s the app or the sites 
For free it’s worth downloading for sure.

title: Essential app for fire-prone areas
review:
As a person who does a lot outdoors (hiking, running, climbing, and Search and Rescue), it’s important to know what the air quality is going to be. Especially in areas prone to fire, or drift smoke, air quality can change quickly. 

Having an app that alerts you to unhealthy air conditions helps me be better prepared and safer. AirVisual does all of that, and it’s simple to use.

title: Amazing app about pollution
review:
I recently went to New Delhi, Punjab, Rajasthan and Haridwar in India.  My chest was burning so I wore my mask to filter out pollution.

I found this app, and it was very helpful to understand what was going on in real time.  This app and system is a Godsend.  I’m glad I live in the mountains of Virginia, where the air is clean most of the year.

Thanks for the great work the developers have made to keep us healthy.

title: Great App
review:
Extremely important to know the air quality where you live.  Infants to age 18 are at risk.
Folks with lung disease or problems and those with sinus issues will/can have a bad reaction and get sick.
The word on air pollution needs to be reiterated over and over.
I’ve talked to so many people and see people outside when the air is unhealthy  - even moms with baby strollers - crazy.
They are just not aware.

title: Very visual, does what it says
review:
I love the flexibility and clarity of the app. I live in California, and we were recently affected by some serious change in air quality (nothing compared to the devastation of Paradise, of course). 

I’m going to keep using it after this current crisis passes now that I’m educated about the fact that air quality changes and can be measured.

title: Comnunity Classifications
review: When the tragic Camp Fire impacted my community With poorbaircquality I stumbled on to this app. It was helpful convincing two Octogenarian parents they should stay inside with their windows closed. It would have been more helpful with the communities in Sacramento were more easier to identify. I work on Rancho Cordova at the old military base and this area wasn’t list. Using the GPS system what it showed as my area is a reference I have never heard in my 50+ years living and working in this city.

title: More sure now
review:
After checking multiple sources and comparing readings, the ones on this app have been consistently wrong.
I finally noticed that the readings are not updated hourly like most, I have 3 cities listed, one reading was two hours and ten minutes since last reading and the other two were 14 hours behind. I like the app itself so I still give it 3 stars, I hope they can get the hourly updates and match the other source readings

title: Clean And modern
review: I never thought I would actually ever need an air quality application. But with my recent travels around the world I realize just the importance of knowing how clean the air quality is to a traveling town or city. Thank you for producing such a wonderful app.

title: PM 2.5
review:
Very helpful in planing trip to Asia as cities visited were unfortunately high with 2.5. Have recommended to several friends. This site has very useful info especially updates on PM 2.5 as they change. 
Should however stress that only mask helpful is a N-95

title: Great Air Quality App
review: Love the ability to check air quality around the world and bookmark various locations of choice. Very easy to use and great data visualizations. Only concern is understanding the validity of some sources. Bottom line, highly recommend.

title: Great!
